lead_intro: Join us as we delve into the dramatic events surrounding the Deepwater Horizon oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico. Test your understanding with the following quiz!

quiz.question: What was the cause of the Deepwater Horizon oil spill?
quiz.explanation: The Deepwater Horizon oil spill was caused by equipment failure on the oil drilling platform.

quiz.question: How many gallons of oil were conservatively estimated to have been lost in the Gulf of Mexico during the spill?
quiz.explanation: Approximately 134 million gallons of oil were conservatively estimated to have been lost during the Deepwater Horizon oil spill.

quiz.question: What was one method attempted to stop the oil leak during the Deepwater Horizon crisis?
quiz.explanation: The 'junk shot' method involved pumping heavy drilling mud and various materials into the well to try to force the oil back down and seal it with cement.

quiz.question: What was the purpose of the Cofferdam in the context of the Deepwater Horizon oil spill?
quiz.explanation: The Cofferdam was designed to contain the oil leak by covering the broken pipe and directing the oil flow to a collection point.

quiz.question: How was the oil flow eventually stopped in the Deepwater Horizon crisis?
quiz.explanation: The oil flow was finally stopped by successfully capping the damaged well after several attempts with different methods.
